documents.title: Live Hacking Playbook (Frans Rosén)
documents.source: Live Hacking Tips and Tricks - Frans Rosen.md
documents.summary: Structured guide for preparing and executing live hacking engagements, covering scope intake, team coordination, recon priorities, tooling workflows, and real-world signal stories.
recommended_prompts: Outline a day-of-action checklist for a HackerOne live hacking event using the provided playbook.
Suggest collaboration workflows for a two-person team targeting enterprise SaaS programs at a live event.

documents.title: Bug Bounties With Bash (TomNomNom)
documents.summary: Practical Bash automation patterns for recon: logging wrappers, subdomain enumeration loops, bulk fetching, and pipeline tuning with concrete command snippets.
recommended_prompts: Generate a Bash script template that mirrors TomNomNom's workflow for enumerating and probing subdomains.
Explain how to capture recon transcripts safely when running high-volume shell commands.

documents.title: Recon Cheat Sheet 2019 Highlights
documents.summary: Reconnaissance playbook spanning code leak hunting, directory fuzzing, asset discovery, and certificate transparency with tooling combos and payout anecdotes.
recommended_prompts: Prioritize recon activities for a newly in-scope acquisition using the cheat sheet.
Draft a responsible disclosure outline for FTP credentials discovered via dumpster diving.

documents.title: Complete Guide to Shodan – Key Takeaways
documents.summary: Reference on Shodan's data model, banner structure, SSL probing, and CLI/API usage including sample JSON snippets and multi-filter queries.
recommended_prompts: Summarize exposed services for a given organization using the Shodan CLI filters.
Explain how to interpret Shodan SSL fields when triaging weak cipher suites.

documents.title: Zseano’s Bug Bounty Methodology
documents.summary: Mindset-focused methodology emphasizing ethical hunting, structured note-taking, feature mapping, and a detailed XSS testing checklist with payload logging guidance.
recommended_prompts: Coach a newcomer through documenting findings using Zseano's note structure.
Walk through an XSS triage conversation that mirrors Zseano’s step-by-step process.

documents.title: Attacking Secondary Contexts in Web Applications
documents.source: Attacking Secondary Contexts in Web Applications (Sam Curry)
documents.summary: Explores how requests traverse proxies, CDNs, and internal APIs, highlighting traversal tricks, header manipulation tactics, and the Authy 2FA bypass as a case study for compounding impact.
recommended_prompts: Outline a step-by-step plan to test for secondary context traversal vulnerabilities on a CDN-backed web app.
Summarize lessons from the Authy 2FA bypass for a security engineering briefing.

documents.title: John Colston (Mayo) — Data-Driven Bug Bounty Playbook
documents.summary: Interview-style playbook detailing Mayo's instrumentation-heavy recon system, KPI funnel, ingredient/recipe wordlists, cost governance, and burnout guardrails drawn from digital marketing experience.
recommended_prompts: Design a KPI logging schema for recon automation inspired by Mayo's methodology.
Suggest ways to adapt Mayo's ingredient/recipe wordlist model to a non-adtech bug bounty program.

documents.title: HackerNotes Ep.86 — X-Correlation Injection Research
documents.summary: Research drop on abusing trace and correlation headers, covering discovery cues, fuzzing tactics, real-world findings, JSON injection angles, and remediation guardrails.
recommended_prompts: Draft a fuzzing playbook for correlation headers that balances error-based and out-of-band techniques.
Explain how to triage potential JSON injection when a trace header value propagates into server-side objects.
